content:
Hi.
Shouldn't the border for Recent Topics on Dark Theme be the same color as the rest of the borders? It is currently black, and probably should be hsla(0,0%,0%,.2) instead.

Ricardo Duarte said:

Hi.
Shouldn't the border for Recent Topics on Dark Theme be the same color as the rest of the borders? It is currently black, and probably should be hsla(0,0%,0%,.2) instead.

From what I have observed in the CSS, most of the borders are hsl(0, 0%, 0%, 0.6)
And I do agree there is a bit of inconsistency in the borders in dark theme.
Like some where it is 0.6, somewhere it is 0.9. Just to add more focus of the user, I guess we use more value of opacity.
Yeah, I agree, that does look off to have the borders on the sides of "Recent topics" not match the other borders in the message feed.
I wanted to match the border color of the navbar so it all looks like a single line.
I assume there is a darker shade of border color in navbar due to separate the search section from others clearly.

body.night-mode #recent_topics_table thead th also seems a bit off by being black.
in my opinion setting body.night-mode .top-navbar-border, body.night-mode #recent_topics_table thead th and body.night-mode .top-navbar-border to hsla(0,0%,0%,.2) makes it look much more consistent.
